items.acceptance_criteria: Create a table listing every top-level file/folder, owner role, and whether it is code, data, config, or output artifact
Produce a one-page call/data-flow diagram covering existing executable paths and confirm at least one concrete entry point
Write a rules specification with at least 20 unambiguous clauses including legal move generation, branching timelines, draw/end conditions, and notation
Publish objective metrics for strength and efficiency including target Elo, target nodes/sec, max latency per move, and compute budget on specified hardware
Summarize at least 12 primary sources spanning AlphaGo/AlphaZero/MuZero, MCTS variants, and multi-agent planning; include method, key result, and applicability score
Build an environment module with seed control and pass 100% of a test suite containing at least 80 rule-validation cases

items.description: Create action-space encoding and legality masks
items.acceptance_criteria: Define reversible action encoding/decoding with collision rate 0 and verify legality mask correctness on 1,000 sampled states
Implement iterative deepening alpha-beta (or equivalent) with transposition table and benchmark at least three depth settings on fixed positions
Create a reproducible match harness running at least 500 games with fixed openings and report win rate, draw rate, average move time, and NPS

items.description: Stand up experiment tracking and dataset logging
items.acceptance_criteria: Log config, git commit, random seeds, and per-game telemetry for 100% of baseline runs; validate replayability on two independent reruns

items.description: Design AlphaGo-style policy-value architecture for 5D state tensors
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify full network with input planes, temporal/timeline encoding, output heads, parameter count, and FLOP budget; complete design review sign-off

items.description: Integrate PUCT-guided Monte Carlo Tree Search
items.acceptance_criteria: Implement PUCT with virtual loss, batched inference, and temperature control; verify tree policy invariants on 200 deterministic test positions
Generate at least 1 million training positions with policy targets, value targets, and provenance metadata while maintaining <1% corrupted samples

items.description: Implement training loop with curriculum and replay management
items.acceptance_criteria: Train for at least 200k optimizer steps with checkpointing every 2k steps; demonstrate stable loss curves and no checkpoint recovery failures
Implement at least two novel mechanisms (e.g., timeline-aware attention, branch-pruning priors, symmetry augmentation) and isolate each via ablation-ready toggles
Execute at least 12 ablation configurations with three seeds each and publish effect sizes on Elo, move latency, and search efficiency

items.description: Benchmark against baselines and prior checkpoints
items.acceptance_criteria: Play at least 2,000 head-to-head games against phase-2 baselines and previous best model with confidence intervals for win rate and Elo

items.description: Measure scaling laws and compute efficiency
items.acceptance_criteria: Profile performance over at least four model sizes and four search budgets; report Pareto frontier of Elo versus GPU-hours and wall-clock latency

items.description: Evaluate robustness on adversarial and rare-state suites
items.acceptance_criteria: Create or curate 300 tactical edge-case positions and report solve rate, blunder rate, and timeline-consistency errors by category
Reproduce top-3 experiment results on a second machine and obtain metric drift below 2% relative for all primary KPIs

items.description: Perform error taxonomy and game-level diagnostics
items.acceptance_criteria: Annotate at least 100 loss/draw games, classify failure modes into at least six categories, and quantify frequency and severity
Deliver a results memo linking each hypothesis to evidence, including statistical significance and practical impact assessment

items.description: Document architecture, training, and evaluation pipelines
items.acceptance_criteria: Produce technical docs with setup, execution, and troubleshooting steps that enable a new contributor to reproduce one full experiment end-to-end

items.description: Create deployment and inference readiness checklist
items.acceptance_criteria: Define acceptance gates for model export, inference throughput, safety guards, and monitoring with explicit pass/fail thresholds
Prioritize at least 10 follow-up experiments by expected value, risk, and cost, and map them to a 3-milestone execution timeline
